result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. BECKER Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full-time employment, schooling, work search or a combination.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

$280.00 portion of these costs are from count 7 which the court ordered be paid as part of extended supervision)

Defendant in custody on writ.

Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for Initial Appearance on 11-23-15 at 9:30 a.m.  
Copy filed.
RE:  2nd degree recklessly endangering safety, on 10-10-15.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess Schedule I or II narcotic, possess THC, possess drug paraphernalia, 1st degree recklessly endangering safety and fleeing an officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 11-23-15 at 9:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he not operate a motor cycle and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold.
Minutes.
